title: HTML Styles
gp1: The HTML style attribute is used to add styles to an element, such as color, font, size, and more.
gp2: Setting the style of an HTML element, can be done with the style attribute.
gp3: The CSS background-color property defines the background color for an HTML element.
gp4: The CSS color property defines the text color for an HTML element:
wp1: The CSS color property defines the text color for an HTML element:
wp2: The CSS font-family property defines the font to be used for an HTML element:
wp3: The CSS font-size property defines the text size for an HTML element:
wp4: The CSS text-align property defines the horizontal text alignment for an HTML element:
